result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell C. Bemis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mitchell C. Bemis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mitchell C. Bemis was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Provide DNA sample within 30 days.

timeConds.notes: STAYED, to be used at the Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell C. Bemis

defendant.name: Bemis, Mitchell C.
defendant.address: W6390 Cty Tk N, Beldenville, WI 54003

records.addlTxt: Counts 1 & 3 - ELR signed 7/18/22 - E: DA, Atty, c: DE, PCSO & Email: Jail. eif
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

04:01 PM Defendant Mitchell C. Bemis in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Loberg agreement reached. DA Hatch: victim's were not informed. 4:01 court recesses. 4:02 Court resumes. DA Hatch: notice sent to victim(s) indicate it could be a plea, ready to proceed w/plea. DA Hatch: guilty to Ct#2, dismiss/read in Ct#1 and dismiss Ct#3. 1 year probation; absolute sobriety, no contact w/ RWB except by phone, 14 days jail- stayed to be used at the Agent's discretion, court costs ($443). Atty Loberg and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def, Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.   Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant pleas guily to Ct#2. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea.  Court finds Defendant is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#2. Court dismiss/read in Ct#1 and dismiss Ct#3. DA Hatch and Atty Loberg address sentencing. Def addresses court.  Court orders 1 year probation: 14 days jail- stayed to be used at the Agent's discretion,   Maintain absolute sobriety. no contact w/ RWB except by phone, Agent may modifiy this condition if the victim requests,   Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 4:20

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: signed by Mitchel Bemis and Attorney Loberg
Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Information filed with the Court.  DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:40 pm.

2:33 PM Defendant Mitchell C. Bemis appears in Court, Atty Jens Hubert Loberg, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Loberg waives the PH.  Written waiver of PHg is filed and the Court reviews with the DE. Court questions and reviews DE's rights.  Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  The Court finds probable cause a felony was committed and binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
filed by DA Halle Hatch. eif
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center today for fingerprints and photograph.
NO CONTACT WITH R.W.B. EXECPT BY TEXT OR PHONE AND NO CONTACT WITH HIS RESIDENCE.
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.

9:36 AM Defendant Mitchell C. Bemis appears in Court, Atty Jens Hubert Loberg, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of NC R.W.B. or his residence and AS, no objection. Court so orders. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 9:42 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
